value.name: AssessVulnerabilityImpact
value.description: Gets a list of assets that have been impacted by a specific vulnerability / CVE
value.descriptionForModel: Gets a list of assets that have been impacted by a specific vulnerability / CVE
examplePrompts: Is my organization impacted by CVE
Am I impacted by that CVE?
Is that CVE relevant to my organization?
Are my cloud assets vulnerable to that CVE?
Are my endpoints vulnerable to that CVE?

inputs.name: VulnerabilityId
inputs.description: ID of the vulnerability / CVE (common vulnerabilities and exposures)

inputs.placeholderValue: The name of the Microsoft product: ["Sentinel", "Defender"].
inputs.name: Product
inputs.description: The name of the Microsoft product: ["Sentinel", "Defender"]. Do **not** fill this in if neither is specified by the user.

inputs.name: TenantId
inputs.description: The Tenant ID to search in.

inputs.name: SentinelWorkspaceName
inputs.description: The name of the Sentinel workspace to search in. Only applicable when the 'Product' parameter is 'Sentinel'.

inputs.name: SentinelWorkspaceResourceGroup
inputs.description: The resource group of the Sentinel workspace to search in. Only applicable when the 'Product' parameter is 'Sentinel'.

inputs.name: SentinelWorkspaceSubscriptionId
inputs.description: The subscription ID of the Sentinel workspace to search in. Only applicable when the 'Product' parameter is 'Sentinel'.

inputs.placeholderValue: Optionally specifies the date time around which to anchor the search query results (six hours before and after).
inputs.name: TimestampAnchor
inputs.description: Optionally specifies the date time around which to anchor the search query results (six hours before and after). Must be in the format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss. Do **not** include this if the user's request doesn't mention anything related to time.

value.name: EnrichIncidentWithDeviceContext
value.description: Retrieve detailed device information from Intune and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. Device information may include device user, manufacturer and model, operating system information, compliance status, and usage-related timestamps.
value.descriptionForModel: Retrieve detailed device information from Intune and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. Device information may include device user, manufacturer and model, operating system information, compliance status, and usage-related timestamps.
examplePrompts: Enrich devices above.
Tell me more about these devices

inputs.name: AadDeviceId
inputs.description: AadDeviceId or AzureAdDeviceId, ID of device registered to AAD, from previous context related to given incident entities

inputs.name: MdeDeviceId
inputs.description: MdeDeviceId or MdatpDeviceId, ID of device registered to MDE, from previous context related to given incident entities

inputs.name: CreatedDateTime
inputs.description: DateTime of device incident being created

inputs.name: TenantId
inputs.description: The Microsoft AAD Tenant GUID. The Tenant ID must be in the format of a GUID. If not provided, the 'Current User's AAD Tenant ID' will be used

value.name: EnrichIncidentWithFileContext
value.description: Enrich incident investigation with file context from Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.  Enriched data may include file hashes, device information, account information, file locations and associated timestamps.

Tell me more about these files.

value.name: EnrichIncidentWithThreatIntelligence
value.description: Enrich a set of IPv4 addresses or a set of hostnames with threat intelligence (TI) context.  The TI context may include reputation information, such as whether a host or IP is malicious or not, ownership (whois) information, and routing information.

inputs.name: Hostnames

value.name: GetIncident
value.description: Gets a summary of an incident given its GUID, number or URL.
value.descriptionForModel:
Gets information about a **single** incident from Sentinel or Defender given one of these 3 identifiers - 
1. A valid Globally Unique Identifier for the incident matching the regex pattern "^[a-f0-9]{8}-([a-f0-9]{4}-){3}[a-f0-9]{12}$".
2. An incident number (**must be** a positive integer).
3. A well-formed incident URL.
 This function can handle **only one** incident identifier (multiple identifiers separated by commas cannot be handled) which **must adhere** to one of the 3 data types mentioned. Otherwise, this function **can not** answer the user's inquiry and hence **must not** be considered. Moreover, **if** the incident identifier is a number, **then** it **must not** be prefixed with text such as "Incident".
 Summary view includes a narrative description of the incident, severity, and timeline. Detailed view includes description, timeline, and details of alerts and entities associated with the incident. This function is invalid for reports, and does not provide any information about the response of the SOC to the incident.
examplePrompts: Get incident 12345
Summarize incident 12345
Get me details on Defender incident
Get incident from Sentinel workspace
Get Sentinel incident from workspace
Get Sentinel incident from
Load Defender incident from tenant
Summarize incident from M365 Defender
Summarize Sentinel incident
Get and summarize incident in cybersecuritysoc workspace
What is incident 79255302-bf6d-4f03-bcd9-f9a9efb3ad08
Can you show me 12345 incident

Get incident /subscriptions/ab48f397-fc82-4634-aa52-62dd91b3ebaa/resourceGroups/sentinel-rg/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/sentinel-workspace/providers/Microsoft.SecurityInsights/Incidents/1309851e-31d3-40c8-986b-8caf9225e951

inputs.name: Incident
inputs.description:
This parameter **only** accepts an incident identifier that **strictly adheres** to one of these 3 formats - 
1. A single GUID matching the regex pattern "^[a-f0-9]{8}-([a-f0-9]{4}-){3}[a-f0-9]{12}$" 
2. A single positive integer 
3. A single URL

inputs.name: IncludeIncidentDetails
inputs.description: True if user would like get a full details of a given incident. False, if user would like to get a summary view

inputs.name: ProductName
inputs.description: Name of the product. You **must** populate this if one of the following values are mentioned in the customer request: [\"Sentinel\", \"Defender\", \"m365\", \"m365d\", \"defender\", \"xdr\", \"sentinel\", \"siem\", \"securityinsights\"]. For example, if the customer request contains \"sentinel incident\", then this should be populated as \"sentinel\".

inputs.name: WorkspaceName
inputs.description: The workspace name, only if explicitly specified in the customer request.

inputs.name: SubscriptionName
inputs.description: The Azure subscription name, only if explicitly specified in the customer request.

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.description: The Azure resource group name, only if explicitly specified in the customer request.

inputs.name: TenantId
inputs.description: The Microsoft AAD Tenant GUID. The Tenant ID must be in the format of a GUID. If not provided, the 'Current User's AAD Tenant ID' will be used

value.name: GetIncidentEntities
value.displayName: Provide entity summary of a given incident
value.description: Gets entities of an incident given its GUID, ID number or URL.
value.descriptionForModel:
Given a **single** incident identifier (from Defender or Sentinel), lists the entities associated to that incident, such as account, File, Host, Ip, Dns, IoTDevice, and other impacted entity types. Should be preferred if user specifically wants information on incident entities, as opposed to other incident details. The incident identifier **must** be in one of these formats **only** - 
1. A valid Globally Unique Identifier for the incident matching the regex pattern "^[a-f0-9]{8}-([a-f0-9]{4}-){3}[a-f0-9]{12}$".
2. An incident number (**must be** a positive integer).
3. A well-formed incident URL.
 This function can handle **only one** incident identifier (multiple identifiers separated by commas cannot be handled) which **must adhere** to one of the 3 data types mentioned. Otherwise, this function **can not** answer the user's inquiry and hence **must not** be considered. Moreover, **if** the incident identifier is a number, **then** it **must not** be prefixed with text such as "Incident".
examplePrompts: Get incident entity
Tell me entities related to
Summarize entities related to
What account is associated with incident 12345
Tell me entity related to incident in workspace
Get Sentinel incident entity from
List all entities in incident 79255302-bf6d-4f03-bcd9-f9a9efb3ad08

Tell me about users linked to incident '/subscriptions/ab48f397-fc82-4634-aa52-62dd91b3ebaa/resourceGroups/sentinel-rg/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/sentinel-workspace/providers/Microsoft.SecurityInsights/Incidents/1309851e-31d3-40c8-986b-8caf9225e951'
List the IPs involved in Sentinel incident

1. A single GUID matching the regex pattern "^[a-f0-9]{8}-([a-f0-9]{4}-){3}[a-f0-9]{12}$" 
2. A single positive integer 
3. A single URL

For example, if the customer request contains \"sentinel incident\", then this should be populated as \"sentinel\".
